cortex.analysis.mri package¶

Submodules¶

cortex.analysis.mri.rois module¶

Module for finding ROIS for MRI niftis

cortex.analysis.mri.rois.check_grey(coords)[source]¶

Function to check if a particular cluster corresponds to grey matter.

This function uses the CA_N27_GW atlas. Other metrics could be used, but this feature needs to be added.

Parameters:coords (tuple or list) – Coordinates, should have length 3
Returns:probability of grey matter
Return type:float
cortex.analysis.mri.rois.check_pair(toproi, rois, lr_cm)[source]¶
cortex.analysis.mri.rois.cluster_worker(fnifti, thr, roi_dict)[source]¶
cortex.analysis.mri.rois.find_clusters_from_3D(fnifti, thr)[source]¶

Function to use afni command line to find clusters from a 3D nifti.

This currently calls afni functions from command line. TODO(dhjelm): change this to use nipy functions.

Parameters:
  • fnifti (str) – Nifti file to process.
  • thr (float) – threshold used for clusters.
Returns:

clusters
Return type:

list
cortex.analysis.mri.rois.find_clusters_from_4D(fnifti, i, thr)[source]¶

Function to use afni command line to find clusters from a 4D nifti.

TODO(dhjelm): change this to use nipy functions.

Parameters:
  • fnifti (str) – Nifti file to process.
  • i (int) – Index of the feature in the nifti file.
  • thr (float) – threshold used for clusters.
Returns:

List of 3d clusters.
Return type:

list
cortex.analysis.mri.rois.find_region_names(coords)[source]¶

Get region names from a set of atlases.

Only 3 atlases are currently supported, but more could be added in the future.

Parameters:coords (tuple or list) – coordinates, chould be length 3.
Returns:List of regions of interest corresponding to a cluster coordinate.
Return type:list
cortex.analysis.mri.rois.find_rois(fnifti, thr, test=False)[source]¶

Function for finding regions of interest from a nifti file.

Parameters:
  • fnifti (str) – path to the nifti file or list of paths to files
  • thr (float) – threshold for clusters.
Returns
dict: regions of interest
cortex.analysis.mri.rois.get_cluster_info(clusters)[source]¶
cortex.analysis.mri.rois.lat_opposite(side)[source]¶

Returns the lateral opposite as defined by the keyword pair {“Right”, “Left”}

cortex.analysis.mri.rois.main(fnifti, thr=0, out_file=None, out_txt=None)[source]¶
cortex.analysis.mri.rois.make_argument_parser()[source]¶

Creates an ArgumentParser to read the options for this script from sys.argv

cortex.analysis.mri.rois.return_region(coords, atlas)[source]¶

Function to return the region of interest as defined by the atlas.

Parameters:
  • cluster (tuple or list) – coordinates, should be length 3
  • atlas (str) – name of atlas to use.
Returns:

List of strings. This should be a list of all the regions

corresponding to a coordinate.
Return type:

list
